segments.text: Hey sweetie.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Hey.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Um.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How's it- going?  Oh I'm so tired.  Oh, I just woke up. Mmm.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What's going on?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Uh, -Um
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why the sad face?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: they need me out there sooner than I thought
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Where?  Who?  What are you talking about?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They want to deploy me next week.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Next week?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Overseas?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: For--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: For how long this time?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They said anywhere from two to three years.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?  What do you mean two to three years?  Don't they know that you have a wife and an expectant child?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I told them that but they--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Honey--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: --need me on the specialist honey.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You can't.  We need you.  I need you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't want to go but,-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care about the money.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: but they said they'd increase my pay by triple-there promotion.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And you're leaving next week so you won't even be here for Anna's birth?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do this whole thing by myself?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Honey you're not going to be by yourself--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We'll have internet set up, we'll get web cameras and everything.  My whole family's here too.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Carry her for nine months and then yes.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Honey.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's not the same thing.  It's not like having you here.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I can't do this.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can do it.  Alright?  You can, you can be strong, you can be strong for both of us alright?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm sick of being strong-- --for us.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know what to do.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't want to - I don't- I don't want to go.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What am I supposed to do?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You can say no?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know I can't say no.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You could.  You really could.  You could-- --get into another line of work.  I could start working after Anna's born?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: The last guy who said no was fired.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I put in fifteen years in this job.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm so close.  Five more years and I retire-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: and we'll have that happy life.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Happiness for me is having you here with me
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: and watch our child grow, see her take her first steps, her first words.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Honey after a year I can be back.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You said two years.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They want me there two years but I could probably get
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: maybe get some vacation-- --once it quiets down there.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: A whole year? --We're not talking about like a couple months here.  I mean this is a whole year.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I know.  I know.  But they really need some good guys there.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What could happen in a year?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And this isn't the first time you know?  I mean you always...sending you off to different places and...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well that's the kind of work I'm in honey.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know if that's how I want to live my life.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's just going to be--it's going to go faster than you think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Joe I'm serious I don't want to have to have a little girl to tell...asking every day where's daddy, where's daddy and have to tell her that he's away--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: far away and he won't be here.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You tell her-- [BREATHING]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm done.  I can't honey.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you mean?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's over.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Honey I can't do it anymore.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Are you kidding me?  No.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I need you here.  Anna needs you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So I have--you want me to choose between you guys or my career?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What am I going to do?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Priorities honey, priorities.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I want to--what am I going to do if I leave this job?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're smart.  You could go back to school--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: finish your Master's that you were started never finished.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Fine.  I'll see if I can talk to them.
